Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS generated during metabolism, mitochondrial origin of ROS, oxidative damage accumulation, and decline in antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Oxidative Damage in Muscle Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage leading to lipid peroxidation, muscle loss (sarcopenia), platelet activation, and inflammation as aging drivers.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes ROS accumulation from metabolism, mitochondrial ROS dual role in signaling and damage, and redox homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and genetic variation in antioxidant enzymes affecting aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights oxidative damage accumulation and the role of antioxidant supplementation (vitamin C) in modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial dysfunction as both source and target of ROS, oxidative damage to proteins and lipids, and CNS aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Oxidative Damage in Muscle Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes lipid peroxidation generating toxic aldehydes like 4-hydroxynonenal, protein modification, and decline in detoxification with age.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS as main source in seeds, oxidative damage accumulation, and antioxidant/repair mechanisms modulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation and cellular antioxidant defense systems influencing lifespan and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS accumulation causing oxidative damage and ROS-induced cellular senescence contributing to aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Oxidative Damage in Muscle Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial oxidative stress in muscle, antioxidant enzyme activity changes, and sarcopenia.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Oxidative Damage in Muscle Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes ROS-driven oxidative damage in muscle tissues, mitochondrial damage, and antioxidant defense in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Glutathione Deficiency and Antioxidant Decline Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on glutathione (GSH) deficiency with age, its role in detoxification, and impact on oxidative damage and cancer susceptibility.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial ROS damage, especially from electron transport chain, and antioxidant enzymes protecting longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, decline of antioxidant defenses, and enhancement of antioxidative enzymes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Lipid Peroxidation and Oxidative Damage in Muscle Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative damage accumulation, protein oxidation, and imbalance between ROS and antioxidant defenses.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related increase in mitochondrial ROS production, decline in antioxidant enzymes, and oxidative damage driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights mitochondrial ROS as major damage source, oxidative stress imbalance, and ROS-induced cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative damage accumulation, decline in antioxidant and DNA repair systems, and oxidized DNA as aging biomarker.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS production, mitochondrial dysfunction, and redox-dependent epigenetic regulation in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS causing damage to multiple aging hallmarks including genomic instability and cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes oxidative stress as imbalance between pro-oxidants and antioxidants causing molecular damage and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Apoptosis and Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS triggering apoptosis via mitochondrial permeability transition, cytochrome c release, and metabolic regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Antioxidant Defense and Oxidative Damage Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes oxidative stress imbalance, antioxidant defense decline, and influence of reproductive activity on oxidative damage.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-Induced Free Radical Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production, oxidative damage accumulation, and correlation with oxidative stress markers in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Redox Signaling and ROS-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights ROS as signaling molecules regulating gene expression, senescence, apoptosis, and redox control of signal transduction.
